headline: Stocks to Watch Recap: Exxon, Chevron, Visa, Occidental
summary: ↗️ Chevron (CVX), Occidental Petroleum (OXY), ConocoPhillips (COP), Exxon Mobil (XOM): Shares in the U.S. energy companies rose Friday between 0.6% and 3.8%, aided by the surge in oil prices after Israel’s attack on Iran.

headline: Occidental Stock Is One of Warren Buffett’s Rare Flubs. Why It Could Rebound.
summary: The oil company’s stock got a solid boost from the surge in oil prices. It has dropped 23% in the past year tied to its heavy debt load.

headline: OXY Stock Outperforms Industry in Last Two Months: How to Play
summary: OXY stock gains 18.8% in two months, outpacing peers as Permian growth, acquisitions and debt cuts drive momentum.

headline: Trump urges Iran nuclear deal, oil stocks, bitcoin & gold prices
summary: Yahoo Finance host Brad Smith tracks today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute, including market reactions (^DJI, ^IXIC, ^GSPC) as President Trump urges Iranian officials to agree to a nuclear deal following Israeli airstrikes, shares gaining for energy companies Chevron (CVX), Exxon Mobil (XOM), and Occidental Petroleum (OXY) on rising Middle East tensions, and the trends in gold (GC=F) and bitcoin (BTC-USD) prices. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Citizens Financial, Merck, oil producers: Trending Tickers
summary: Citizens Financial Group (CFG) will be expanding its share buyback program to $1.5 billion. Pharmaceutical giant Merck (MRK) received approval from the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) to use Keytruda to treat head and neck cancer. Shares of American oil producers, namely Occidental Petroleum (OXY), climb higher in response to spiking oil prices (CL=F, BZ=F) after Israel coordinated airstrikes against Iran. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here.

headline: Oil gains likely to revert after Israel's Iran attack: Analyst
summary: Oil prices (CL=F, BZ=F) are jumping by the largest amount in three years following Israel's airstrikes targeting Iran's nuclear facility and military leadership. Iranian officials have labeled Israel's attacks as a "declaration of war." Hedgeye Risk Management energy analyst Fernando Valle discusses with the Morning Brief's Brad Smith on what this escalating conflict means for his outlook on oil producers and the energy sector and the risk exposure for major American producers. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

headline: Warren Buffett Is Wagering 72% of Berkshire Hathaway's $283 Billion of Invested Capital on These 7 Unstoppable Stocks
summary: The Oracle of Omaha has concentrated a majority of Berkshire's invested assets in a handful of his best ideas.
